scenario 1.background: In the bustling cafeteria of the marketing firm, Mary notices Michelle looking particularly stressed while sorting through a pile of emails on her laptop.

dialogue.Mary: I understand. I remember there was an important email about the upcoming project. Did you get a chance to see it?
dialogue.Michelle: I might have missed it in this chaos. Thanks for the heads up, I'll check it right away.

scenario 2.background: After reminding Michelle about the email, Mary senses that Michelle might feel she's overstepping. They meet again in the office lounge.

dialogue.Mary: I'm glad to hear that. I've been there too, missing out on emails when things get hectic. It’s really about us supporting each other.
dialogue.Michelle: Oh, not at all, Mary. I actually appreciate the reminder. It’s easy to miss things when it’s busy.

scenario 3.background: Feeling that Michelle appreciated her approach, Mary decides to strengthen their professional relationship by inviting her to weekly lunch meetings. They discuss this over coffee.

dialogue.Mary: Michelle, I’ve been thinking about how we handle these busy periods. What do you think about having a weekly lunch meeting where we can sync up and even de-stress a bit?
dialogue.Michelle: That sounds like a fantastic idea, Mary. It would really help to have a set time to catch up and manage the workload together.

scenario 4.background: During one of their regular lunch meetings, Mary feels uncertain about whether the frequency of the meetings is too much for Michelle.

dialogue.Mary: Michelle, I wanted to check in with you about our weekly lunches. I hope they’re not becoming another item on your already full plate?
dialogue.Michelle: Actually, I look forward to them. They’re a breath of fresh air during the week. But I appreciate you checking in.

scenario 5.background: Encouraged by Michelle’s positive feedback, Mary feels happy and proposes to extend the invitation to other team members to join the lunch meetings. They discuss this idea while walking back to their desks.

dialogue.Mary: Michelle, since these lunches are working out well, how would you feel about inviting some other team members? It might enhance our team support even more.
dialogue.Michelle: I think that’s a great idea. It could really boost morale and improve our collaboration. Let’s do it!
